Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Huge 36X zoom lens with great 22.5 - 810 mm range; Well designed, lightweight, easy-to-hold body; Beautiful articulating 3-inch LCD with good outdoor visibility; Fast start-up time for super zoom; Plenty of manual controls; Scene Auto Selector picks a scene mode for you; Handy side zoom controller lets you zoom while keeping the camera steady; Well-implemented sweep panorama feature; Not much redeye; Full HD movie mode, with stereo sound, use of optical zoom, and full-time autofocus; Fun variable frame rate mode allows for slow or fast motion videos; Lots of built-in memory; HDMI output
Cons: Images are soft, over-processed/fuzzy, with noticeable detail loss, even at base ISO; Poor high ISO performance; Movie mode annoyances: delay before movie recording starts, lack of "re ... al" image stabilization, sluggish AF; No RAW support; Lengthy write times after burst is taken; Below average battery life --very slow internal charging; Hard to keep camera steady at telephoto; EVF resolution is not great; More direct buttons or a quick menu would've been nice; Can't access memory card while camera is on a tripod; Full manual on CD-ROM
he Nikon Coolpix P500 is a super zoom camera with the world's most powerful zoom lens. It packs a whopping 36X, 22.5 - 810 mm lens into a relatively small and light package. The P500 has a number of popular point-and-shoot features, such as auto scene selection, face/smile/blink detection, and special effects, plus full manual controls. It also has the ability to record Full HD video with stereo sound and use of the optical zoom lens. All of these features are accessed via a beautiful articulating 3-inch LCD or so-so electronic viewfinder. Unfortunately, the P500's images are soft, with lots of detail loss, even at low ISOs (and forget about high sensitivities). expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very Happy I Purchased This Camera!
Item.Review: I have been an amateur photographer for the past 10 or so years and finally needed to upgrade my old Canon camera. I would have liked to have gotten a DSLR but the money just isn't there right now. My main uses for this camera are family and vacation photos, and my priority in life, my 18 month old son. I also have any interesting career and love getting shots of things people normally don't get to see. After about a month of doing research, I finally decided on the Nikon Coolpix P500, and I'm very pleased I did. I was looking for a camera with a long zoom, good picture quality and some more options so I could expand my photographic ability. I was looking at the Canon SX 40, Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ150, Sony HX100, etc. There were things I liked and disliked about every model, including t ... he Nikon, and reading reviews was making my head spin. I chose the Nikon P500 because I liked it's features as a whole compared to the other models. This camera has good image quality, indoors and out, I have had good experience with low light shooting, the battery has held a very good charge (150 pictures and not even half empty), it focuses very quickly and I feel that the interface is user friendly. Also, the housing seems very durable and fits my hands very well. The only negative thing about this camera is that you have to charge the battery while inside the camera. I ended up buying two more batteries and a wall charger to solve that issue. Two things I can say that I would like to see on future Nikon cameras equivalent to this one would be a hotshoe attachment and the ability to shoot in RAW. The 1080p video is very good, but I only tested it out once. I have a Panasonic HD camcorder I use for shooting videos so that was not a reason for purchasing this camera. I am extremely happy with the service I received from B&H. They have a friendly, very knowledgeable staff and I have made this my go-to store from now on. Nobody could beat the price I bought this for either, and free shipping!?! One thing I suggest to people who would like to dig deeper into this camera other than just using the Auto setting would be to pick up a book called Photographer's Guide to the Nikon Coolpix P500 by Alexander White. It is available as paperback or the cheaper route is to download it in pdf version. I actually know how to use this camera's features now. All I can say is do your homework and take a lot of reviews with a grain of salt. Make sure you get to a store so you can physically hold each camera to get a better feel for it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera for my wife who wanted more than just a point-and-shoot, but not a full SLR. She absolutely loves it. It is great for using as a point-and-shoot, with several built in scene modes that allow a novice to automatically adjust for difficult shooting conditions. If you want more than a point-and-shoot, there are a lot of modes in which you can use this camera. Probably way more than you will ever use, but they are fun to play around with. You can spend hours going through the full manual, which only comes in electronic form. The picture resolution is more than adequate for almost all needs. I took a picture of a box of cereal sitting on a table where the box filled less than a quarter of the frame. I was able to blow up the original picture to the point where I coul ... d easily read the small print on the side of the box. However, picture quality is not so good in low light conditions. The display screen is very nice with good resolution, though it can get washed out when you are in bright sun. However, it does have a viewfinder you can use if you can't see the screen. The battery life is a little on the short side. The camera also only comes with an in-camera battery charger, and it can take up to 4 hours to charge. You can't use the camera while the battery is charging. I recommend buying a spare battery, and an external battery charger (MH-61) which charges the battery in half the time. The zoom range is quite impressive, and the image stabilization is decent. Of course with extreme zoom you are best using a tripod. Unfortunately, there is no way to attach filters to the lens. So if you like to add a 1A filter to protect the lens, you're out of luck. Overall, I highly recommend this camera. It is easy to use for novices, but allows a ton of adjustments for more experienced users. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good photo and video quality
Cons: learning to change the settings to get the best point and shoot
Bought the camera for my husband for Christmas. Camera 1: the speakers did not work. When recording videos you could not hear anything. 45 min. on the phone with Nikon showed it was nothing I was doing wrong. They suggested I take it back. Camera 2: worked great/ video great/ speakers great, but, there was something loose inside it. You could hear it rattle when you picked up the camera. Took it back. Camera 3: works great/pictures are clear and video perfect. My husband loves the tilt back screen. The zoom is wonderful. Battery life is better than I had read about. To keep the auto focus sound from the videos change the setting off auto. Best Buy has been great in helping ... with the exchanges. I think this one is a keeper. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Terrific Zoom on better than average camera
Item.Review:
Pros: Zoom, lightweight, fits in big pocket
Cons: Battery life, little bit short on picture sharpness
Have been a Nikon user since the Photomic FTN's in the 1960's. Expected more from this Nikon in the way of picture quality - Not quite the equal of similarly priced Canons. The battery life with the 8Wa seems very short , suggest using the very good optical viewfinder as much as possible. Viewscreen very bright but seems to drain power quickly. That being said, the camera is easy to use, picture quality (at 3Meg setting) is acceptable but not outstanding. Color quality washed out, image not as sharp as expected. Any Photoshop elements program can easily fix any defects, though. Zoom is the envy of my Nikon DSLR owner-friends. Fits in cargo pants pocket, Overall value for pric ... e is great. I'd buy again. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Large Clear LCD; Great Zoom
I got this primarily for shooting my kids' sports teams to produce team DVDs. It is veratile enough to handle every kind of shot (video, portraits to long zoom action) without having to carry around additional lens. The tilt screen is another welcome feature as it means you do not have to be holding the camera up to your face all the time waiting for "that shot".
Overall it meets my needs. I do not have an issue with image quality. It is good enough for my purposes. I use a mono-pod for long zoom so the camera's image stabilization is sufficient--Canon SX30 has best IMO. Only drawbacks so far:
Lag time for video capture to begin. Lag time to save continuous shooting to memory. Could get better quality with any one feature but I a ... m content with the package, especially at this price point. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very nice camera, great zoom, wide-angle
Item.Review: I liked this product, it has a great wide angle, photo quality is very good (a little on softer side) but it has great features like a dSLR. Low light shooting is also good. Camera is extremely light weight as per its size. Ergonomically easy to handle and use. Great video quality. Best part is - it has manual controls that are very easy to use.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The Nikon P500 is easy to use. It takes great pictures in most conditions. Daylight shooting is tremendous. Pictures are crisp and colors are vibrant. Shooting in nighttime conditions has proven quite difficult. When shooting with the flash or in low light conditions, there is a long delay from the time you press the shutter button to when the picture is taken. The resulting pics are often poor quality, but occasionally yield a gem. I am a semi-professional photographer (EOS 7D), and often pass the Nikon P500 around at family functions, and let others click away. For the money, it is a great camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Settings which let you make the best of any scenario (bar none)
Cons: Battery life! I may need to purchase an extra one as a backup.
I purchased this literally 30 minutes before going on a Kayaking trip and was really happy with the results. I've used it during swamp treks as well as office / club functions. It actually blew away a colleagues Sony (with a heavy duty lens) when it came to the quality of the pictures. I take a lot of nature pictures and the details are clean. You do need to select the proper settings based on what you're shooting pictures of if you really want to put it through it's paces. Don't just set it to automatic, you'll miss out!
The Pros - Lightweight, great zoom, flexibility in various light scenarios, plenty of features, video. The Co ... ns - Low internal memory and extremely short battery life! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Good quality photos, videos Full HD. Undoubtedly there are cameras make better pictures and a lower price, but I´m not doing photography for exhibitions. As a hybrid photo and video camera, it is quite a worthy representative. A wide selection of modes for shooting. There are manual settings (for example, shooting at night) Very easy to navigate in the menu. Impressive zoom.
Main advantages: - Good quality photos - Full HD video camera for a decent quality - Easy to use both the ergonomics and the management - A lot of manual settings, wide possibilities for combining automatic and manual settings. - Automatic mode works quite well - Good optics with 36x zoom. - Complete detailed instruction for beginners

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Slow to focus on quick shots, blurring.
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Zoom; Large Clear LCD; Small / Compact
Cons: Slow auto-focus; Lag / Shutter Delay; Short Battery Life
Action shots are frequently out of focus. Still shots are great. Zoom is good. Must have back-up batteries.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice form factor
Cons: 1. Poor construction quality, 2. Poor quality images
Having been a long-time Nikon user (FM2, F3s) I needed a good point-and-shoot that would give me a little bit more than the normal and, thus, went for this camera. After only 6 months of use I can only say that the photos are of terrible quality, not sharp, exposures way off, colors totally wrong. And now the flash mode switch on the rocker dial won't work, it's broke. I could never recommend this camera to anyone as, for the price paid, there are far better cameras out there in this class and price range. I'm highly surprised that Nikon would allow something of this poor of quality out in the public sector. As I am about to purchase a DSLR I'm afraid I'll need to look long and hard at ... some other options other than Nikon... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I purchased this little camera so I would not need to carry the backpack with multiple bodies, lens & other stuff. I have had this camera for only twelve days, but this is what I found thus far. Because the camera uses contrast to see objects to focus on, distant zooms, like a mountain ridge 8 miles away causes the camera to hunt. Another problem I've found, the camera is unable to focus on objects 3 to 5 feet away when the camera zooms to or near the max zoom, even in close up mode. I photograph bugs & there are some you don't want to be close too. The camera just hunts and sometimes takes a fuzzy picture. This camera has far more options than my D200 has, so I have not explored many of them yet. I may be doing something wrong, but video seems to be jumpy. This is my first atte ... mpt at learning video. Nikon software creators, please make you programs compatible to the Linux operating systems. I am not able to use the supplied CD. It is a waste to me. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: size, zoom range, good battery life
Cons: slow shutter without flash, even in moderate light.
Wanted a camera with full HD video, but the D3100 was too expensive for me at the time, and with an additional zoom lens, the D3100 would have been over $1000, so I got the P500 instead. It has the 36X zoom, and was an upgrade in MP (12.1mp) over my D40. I don't think the picture quality is necessarily better than the D40, but the zoom range and the compact size and less weight make up for sacrificing some manual features I lost switching from a DSLR to a compact. Picture quality is still very good, and the video quality was surprisingly good in low light.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm getting used to this thing. The huge megazoom is difficult to keep centered on faraway objects at max out (without a brace), but I'm getting it. Also, the shutter is not as quick as my D70, but then it didn't cost me nearly what a D70 used to cost or a D90 now. Still it is quick, just not quite as quick. I find I need to anticipate shots a bit better. This is no time machine or instant point and shooter. Autofocus sometimes takes a bit. But oh that megazoom! That's the definition of power baby!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
I really like this camera. We had a 5 year old camera that still took great pictures, but only in good light. We decided to spend the money and get a camera that would hopefully take great pictures in any lighting situation. This camera does.
The 1080 video is an added bonus. My only complaint would be that if the light is bad the video is dark (Which you should expect). But this was bought for still photos, so it's not a deal breaker for me. We have a video camera for videos.
The zoom is also great, but I find the control a bit sensitive. Again, not a deal breaker. Be warned, this is not a small camera. It's not huge, but unlike some that you can throw in your pocket you must hold or use the neck strap with this one.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for a low price
Item.Review: This camera is sooo much nicer than the Kodak camera I have used for years. The picture is taken with very little lag. Color and auto light levels are really nice... right in the ball park. White balance is something I am picky about and the auto white balance on this is right there. I am still learning to use the options. This camera has a picture quality that is fun to look at. I still need a pocket camera, but this shoots nice pictures. The flash fills the whole frame and at distance lights the subject twice as nice as previous cameras I have owned. Strong flash is so nice to have. I wish I could configure this for just one flash so I could use my old slave strobe for fill... but most digital cameras today have a pre-flash even if red eye is off. Great camera. You won't be so ... rry with this! The steady shot works well. the zoom on this model is like... wow. thumbs up for me! If I wish this camera had a different system for the lens cap. You can not turn on the camera with the lens cap on. The lens will try to extend and hit the cap. You will then get a warning message. This is my only complaint. -Glenn expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I have been using a 4GB SDHC card, therefore I have been using the 720p setting for recording in HD. I like to try to use features, then go and read in the manual how I should be using them. It does take some getting used to as far as composing, due to a little bit of lag time. I have a lot to learn as far as the manual settings go. I recently purchased a 32GB SDHC card and with the battery a bit on the low side, picture quality set to fine and the 1080p setting for HD, the camera seemed a bit sluggish. However, I have set autofocus to 'on' and do expect a little more power drain due to the additonal features being enabled. I do like the feature of showing the taken picture for about a second after taking the picture. Although in high action situations that would not be a good thing. I ... expect I will be using the video mode in those cases I need to have the high activity. I have not noticed a lot of shear with the video, but I have not used the camera in that kind situation. I do expect to try some sport situations with it. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: It is a wonderful super-zoom camera: easy to use, lots of options to control BUT the poor image quality particularly in low light. I tried quite a few pictures and found that in every picture red and yellow seem to be faded while blue and green are enhanced. It gets really worse in pictures taken without flash. With VIVID setting, it still does not give REAL RED/YELLOW. I do not want orange where is should be red. Tried all kinds camera settings (white balance, image quality, exposure, etc) but could not get it right. I love Nikon but would say this P500 is a failure. I would recommend to buy other brand super-zoom camera. If a camera can not give you real (or close to real) color, then what is it good for? I returned one and B&H graciously sent me another one and that has the same ... problem. It looks like the faded red/yellow is a generic defect of P500. Those who left a review saying it gives true color, please give me the secret. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: adjustable LCD, many settings, clear shots
Cons: not able to change lense types
upgrading to this from a point n shoot was the best decision ever. the LCD adjustable screen helps get better quality shots from all angles and also has many various options for shooting based off of the lighting of the object. definitley worth the $$

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Would not recommend for a beginner
Item.Review:
Pros: Has a screen and a view finder
Cons: Short battery life
Pictures come out ove expossed on automatic and scene auto selector not reliable. Sunset setting not very good. Poor quality (noisy) for indoor pictures. Clear & Crisp images sporadic. Camera will turn on then shut off if lens cap is on. If camera is on a specific setting (ex. backlight) it will not keep that setting after shutting down. Flash doe not go up automatically when needed. The battery didn't last the day.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've found it fairly intuitive right out of the box. I breezed through the manual, (which is on CD) but i was shooting with it right out of the box. The full manual mode is a nice feature. I've played around with it and it can make dramatic improvements in your photos, even though the standard program mode is more than adequate. I've had no problems with the battery going dead, as I had read in some of the reviews. My camera does have the 1.1 version of the software. I'm planning on taking the camera on an upcoming vacation. The wide angle of the lens is great for taking self pictures of the family. I've noticed that sometimes the focus would take a few tries, but I switches to center and that problem has gone away.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: No Lens Shade; No Manual: How Sad
Item.Review: A lens shade is required. It is a simple item: there was one with my first P&S hi-zoom camera 5 years ago. A printed manual is required. In testing this camera, I needed to review advanced features, and was unable to, as I do not have a portable computer or electronic book. I want neither in the field. In use the electronic viewfinder was a puzzle: the image seemed to drift as I tried to focus and frame. When, for a few pictures, I tried to adjust the f-stop in Aperture Priority mode, I was unable to set a smaller f-stop than f8. This may have been a use issue solved by some direction in the manual, but there is no manual in the field. The camera is a good package: panoramas were fun. Images looked fine (for the small bit of testing I did). Good zoom. Small footprint and t ... hus great for travel. If you can memorize the CD manual and like flare, here you go.... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Cons: Just about everything
This camera takes photos that are about as good as something you get from a $100 point and shoot. Slow cumbersome and very disappointing. The only feature that is good is the long zoom but even that suffers from slowness. Battery life is terrible. There even seems to be an issue using various SD cards. A good idea very poorly executed. Nikon just lost another customer to Canon.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: COOLPIXP500BK - Nikon COOLPIX P500 Black 12.1 Megapixel Digital Camera review
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality,Easy To Use,Great wide angle lens,Great Zoom,Short Lag Time,Fast/accurate auto-focus
I use a camera for business purposes, sort of like a real estate agent taking pictures of a house for sale. For ages I've used a Nikon 8400 because it had a great wide angle lens and was big enough to look legitimate, but small enough to travel easily and hang around my next for 8 hours. I've tried SLRs and other more expensive options, but they didn't do a better job, they were just more expense, heavier and bulkier.Unfortunately, my beloved 8400 had seen better days; it was lagging and as a result, getting blurry and poor in low light.I'd been avoiding switching to an SLR or Micro 4/3rds with a wide angle and then saw the P500 show up on [@] as an upcoming camera. One c ... omparison trip to [...] and I could see that the P500 has the exact range of the 8400 (wide).ABT had the best deal when you figure in shipping and tax, so I ordered right away.For the most part, it's exceeded expectations. The wide angle is exactly what I was looking for, so right off the bat it was a winner. Surprisingly, I've already used the long zoom more than I was expecting. It looks a little funny coming out of such a compact camera, but it worked great. The only problem was finding my target (it can really zoom). It's fast, easy to use and has all the options you'd expect from a digital camera these days.The only 'complaints' so far are the flash and the lens cap. First, as far as I can tell, the flash only pops-up manually (i.e. you have to push a button to pop it up, otherwise, you shoot without). I often shoot in mid-light conditions, but I suppose I can keep the flash up during those times (and take the small risk of catching it on something). Second, the lens moves out a little on start-up and if you haven't removed the lens cap, it seizes up and you have to restart. As someone who would normally keep the camera on and take the lens cap on and off, this is a minor annoyance, but I'm sure I'll get used to it in time. On a related note, there's no dedicated "review" setting, so you need to turn the camera on to view and existing photos. That means the lens cap has to come off or you're back to the camera seizing up again.None of those problems are deal breakers and I'm still happy with the camera, but they cost it a star. Maybe I missed something, some settings, some tricks, if anyone else knows some, please let me know, and if I did, I'll update the review and give it back the last star. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nice addition to the Nikon system
Item.Review: As a longtime Nikon user/owner, I wanted something small and lightweight to be that always available camera when it's impractical to lug one or two SLRs and lenses in a shoulder bag. So far the P500 seems to fit the bill. What is truly astounding is the relative lack of distortion at the wide and telephoto ends of this zoom lens. For such an inexpensive lens, the performance is nothing short of amazing. Are all aspects of all images perfectly resolved and razor sharp - no, but even these shortcomings can be tolerated, for what the P500 provides overall. Note - after buying a suitable case, the next purchase has to be an external charger and spare battery. Unacceptable to have to take the camera out of service for 4+ hours just to charge the battery on board. My only real complaint ... s are (1) would like to have the ability to attach a protective filter to the lens (lens hood would be kind of questionable, with a 22-840 mm zoom range, (2) provide a protective cover for the LCD display, and (3) provide an interlock or change the startup logic such that the lens does not start zooming until the lens cap is removed. All in all a nice overall package for the experienced Nikon user. A bit too pricey and over-featured for novice point-and-shooters. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: This camera can do it ALL
Item.Review: I wanted a SLR camera but wasn't ready for the financial plunge. I chose this camera because all of its features will produce the same results I need. The optics are phenomenal, the zoom is incredible and the photos are crisp and clear. It's lightweight, but has a good grip. I like that the battery can just be plugged into the wall. There is nothing I don't like about this camera. Highly recommend for beginners or pros.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is the error I get whenever the camera turns on after the camera resumes from Auto Off. By default the camera will turn off after 1 minute to extend the battery life. Whenever I pressed the shutter release or power button to turn my camera back on the error message Cannot use this card was displayed. The only way I found to get around this error was to remove the battery for a few seconds then turn the camera back on. I then had to set the Auto Off timer to 30 minutes. As long as I manually turn the camera off I have no problems. If the Auto Off feature turns the camera off I have to remove the battery. I am using a SanDisk Extreme 8GB HD movie card that was recommended with the camera. I am a dedicated Nikon user but I cannot recommend this camera until this major issue is ad ... dressed. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I needed this camera to take to Europe for my daughter's wedding. I ordered it with one-day air and it came right on time. I quickly read the instructions and flew off to her wedding. I used the camera for shooting candids of the wedding and the remainder of my vacation. The pictures are of exceptional quality. I also like the ability to use the range finder when sun light makes it hard to see the monitor. It was intuitive to use and light weight to carry. The zoom is exceptional and the camera performs especially well in low light. I found it easy to switch to movie mode and to playback and delete images. I am throughly pleased with this camera and the quality of the photographs and movies.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted to try some more sophisticated manual settings on a less expensive camera before buying a full DSLR outfit. I love all of the Auto settings and the manual feature has been an eye opening experience to shoot with. The video is very good quality and I m impressed at sturdy it feels. As I use it more, I m sure I ll update this, but my initial impressions are A+! Update: After using this for a month, I have utilized more features and wanted to report. The multi-shot feature was excellent when attending a MLB game. We got some wonderful shots with the great zoom.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera. Easy to use right out of the box.
Item.Review: I love this camera. I've always had a small "point and shoot" to slip in my pocket. I was afraid to get a larger camera, but this camera is worth the extra effort to carry. I use it in auto mode, without flash, most of the time in all kinds of light and the pictures come out great. The 36X optical zoom with stabilization was the selling feature for me. 36X seems like a lot but the stabilization feature makes it easy, even without a tripod. Nikon knocked it out of the park with this one.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality; Large Clear LCD; Good Image Stabilization; Small / Compact; Easy To Use
Love the compactness of a 35mm in this camera. Takes as good as, if not better pictures than those higher priced, more expensive 35mm's. I take pictures of all kinds and this camera does great with them all.............action, still life, portraits, etc. Great camera...............

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: What a piece of bad design
Item.Review: I am a profressional who likes these bridge cameras for travelling. I love my Canon S30IS. This one is not worth buying. I tried to give it a fair shake for a week. I finally gave up and I will return it. It's exposure meter is off by 1-2 stops almost all the time. Whether program or manual, makes no difference. The exposure meter is tiny, consists of a light yellow overlay on a white background, almost impossible to read, even if it were accurate. Changing the exposure does not change the image in the viewfinder or monitor, which means you don't know if your picture has been properly exposed until AFTER you take it. With my Canon camera, you can see if your exposure is correct in the viewfinder image. If it is too dark or too light, you know it as you adjust the expsoure. With this camer ... a, you know nothing. The ghistogram gives you no information, because it is the histogram of the very bright, properly exposed image IN THE VIEWFINDER, not of the actual exposure you're making. Useless information. Batteries are Nikon only, not AA. you have to cahrge them in camera. Bad luck if you have only one and/or want to take pictures and charge batteries at the same time. Closeup function doesn't even make sense. no wonder Nikon is #2 or #3 now, if this is what they are designing. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great speed to write to memory card with faster sd card
Cons: Large learning curve compared to my kodak
This camera takes great pictures! For me, it is taking awhile to adjust from my Kodak. There are many great features, but they are "different " from my old camera. For the most part, I am a point and shoot kind of girl. I like to play with the different settings to see what changes in the picture. I got an awesome colorful picture of a play that my neice was in. It looked professional!! I would recommend a book other than the owners manual. (One that goes into detail) It really has helped me. I gort a picture of the full moon that actually showed detail! You need time and patience to learn the features. But it is worth it

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
first i get the Nikon L120 and I just returned to the store because I saw the P500 on the advertising of Nikon and the difference is enough, this camera can be operated in manual mode as a type D and is driving the spectacular lighting of the environment. the battery lasts long enough, the mode of focus using the viewfinder is also very useful and also with the retractable screen is very good too.
The Nikon P500 has an incredible zoom and macro quality definitions, I also get the camera with the mini tripod wich is very useful for landscape mode, I think that's it I feel very comfortable with the camera that aspect besides being rigid and built in thin materials is a plus more and just be Nikon.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Zoom
This camera was a great upgrade for me. It's easy and fun to use. It takes bright, clear pictures and has lots of settings and options for a point and shoot camera. I enjoy using the pull-out screen. In all, this is a great camera for photo enthusiasts!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: zoom
Cons: baterry life, shutter speeds, video. etc...
I purchased this unit two days before Christmas. I used it for the first time on Christmas Eve and all of my pictures were blurry! I reset the device twice hoping that would fix it. Wrong! I tried exchanging it on the 26th but the store was sold out and I had a flight at midnight. i decided to take it with me to Michoacán, Mexico for a family reunion hoping I would master the camera. Wrong! This camera ruined my Christmas and my long awaited family reunion. I am returning the product tomorrow. I’m surprised it's still in one piece.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The autofocus does seem a bit slow -- as other reviewers have mentioned. I have been using a Sony DSC-F717 for many years and so am not used to the in and out movement of the lens -- it is annoying that you must remove the lens cap to accommodate that movement even if you just want to review photos you've already shot... However this Nikon seems like it fits the niche of manual control, eyepiece viewfinder option and long zoom. Good deal for the price!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The lens range is awesome and I like the many shooting options it has. Great camera for the price. Haven't had a problem with the battery life issue because I got a second battery plus a charger.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: easy ,takes great shot the zoom len is on the money!
Cons: you should have intructions on how to use it!
when i first saw it i knew i was going to buy it, It takes excellent picture along with the auto-focus is an excellent camera for beginners!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The Nikon P500 has the main features I need for nature and landscape photography. It goes to 16x optical telephoto [800/50=16x, not 36x- that comes from digital tele] from a super wide angle, minus 2x. It has great image stabilization for up to about 10x, but then you need a tripod. The image clarity is wonderful and the light metering very accurate. The panorama capabilities are very good as well. This camera is an unbelievable value! To do the same with a DSLR, I would need to carry 20 pounds of lenses costing 20K$. This is by far the best solution I have ever seen for nature and landscape photography at a reasonable price unless one wants the workout of carrying all of the extra pounds around from big lenses. Only a professional requiring big blowup enlargements would need the ... super-expensive lenses. This is now my number one camera, and I take 5000 to 10,000 photos per year as a non-professional. I recommend the Nikon P500 highly and without reservation. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera a couple of weeks after it came out and so far I m in love. I m a total amateur, so I bought this camera as an intermediate between my pocket point and shoot and a full blown DSLR. I wanted to try some more sophisticated manual settings on a less expensive camera before buying a full DSLR outfit. I love all of the Auto settings and the manual feature has been an eye opening experience to shoot with. The video is very good quality and I m impressed at sturdy it feels. As I use it more, I m sure I ll update this, but my initial impressions are A+! Update: After using this for a month, I have utilized more features and wanted to report. The multi-shot feature was excellent when attending a MLB game. We got some wonderful shots with the great zoom. Additionally, I experime ... nted with some lifestyle shots and nature shots and was able to get great results. I ordered some 8x10 prints and they came out extremely crisp and clear. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for more than point and shoot
Item.Review:
Pros: The many features.
Cons: The flash does not automatically deploy. Must be released manually.
I'm just getting to know this camera but I love what I've learned so far. It is easy to use and the features fall right in line with my experience as an amateur film photographer. It easily moves between automatic, to programmed, to shutter priority and aperture priority. I also love the video feature and the ease with which video can be replayed on the camera display. The 32X zoom is fantastic. The only downside is that in order for the flash to operate in the automatic mode it must be released manually.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: zoom lens reach
Cons: quality control by Nikon
After a few shots the camera would not turn on. Removing the battery and reinserting it worked 3 or 4 times but then-- later-- this did not help. Then with no indication from the battery charge indicator, the battery ran down and the camera would not turn on again at all. Either the power switch or the battery -- or both -- are defective. When I was a professional photographer I owned Nikon cameras for years with excellent results. As I said in my summary -- I am really disappointed with this Nikon product.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Compact Camera That's Has LOTS of Punch
Item.Review: I use the camera for casual point and shoot. Besides our digital DSR, which is too bulky and heavy to carry around. P500 is compact and very light and fits perfectly into my 12 year old daughter's hand and once you learn how to program you can do serious photographry or just set the camera into auto and be worry free. It takes great pictures and great HD video, but the battery life is very short so I would recommend buying/carrying an extra with you just in case.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera, just read the manual
Item.Review:
Pros: small size, zoom, tilt screen, features, picture quality, ease of use (when you read the manual)
I cannot begin to tell you how many reviews and comparisons I read for the Nikon p500 and the Canon sx30is. I loved things about each camera, but ended up choosing the Nikon in the end. I am very glad that I did.
While I was waiting for the camera to fully charge, I decided to sit and read both the quick start user guide and the full user guide on the provided disk. I even printed out a few pages to put in my camera bag for reference. I believe this made using the camera much easier the first time. I was able to easily find my way through the menus and set the various modes and settings for each particular situation. After about an hour of taking continuous pictures with var ... ious settings, I felt that I had the hang of things. The only reason I gave it a 4.0 out of 5.0 for ease of use is because not everyone will sit and read the entire manual, and as a result they might have trouble just picking up the camera and shooting.
The camera takes wonderful pictures when the proper modes and settings are set. The only time I seem to get a blurry picture is if I happen to shake a bit, or my cats move too quickly (neither of which are the fault of the camera itself). I also love the feel of the camera; I have large hands for a woman (9" from pinky to thumb) and I find it easy to hold and use the controls at the same time. One of my only complaints (and it is a very minor complaint) about the camera itself is that you cannot view your pictures with the lens cap on; however, I can easily overlook that because of all of the other great things about it.
I am not one of those people that things that there is a one-size-fits-all anything. I took a lot of time reading reviews for many cameras before I finally narrowed it down to two, then ultimately chose the Nikon. I am no professional photographer by any means, but this camera has everything that I wanted and then some. It takes wonderful pictures, and it is a breeze to operate after you read the manual. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've done short videos and photos using the zoom feature - a lot. After some experimenting, it is pretty intuitive. Like previous reviews, the clarity of the photos is very good but not amazing. I think this is a trade off with the zoom feature. Buy an extra battery.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I've got hooked onto the huge optical zoom of this P500 and trusted Nikon to come up with some minimal Nikon optical quality. I wasn't disappointed. 12MP is adequate, optical zoom is plentyful, picture quality is very good for a point and shoot. I would recommend this camera to any point and shooters who do not mind a little bit of a large size that comes with a 36 x opt zoom. The only drawback is that battery does not seem to last long enough. But this is only a feeling as I have not compared it to the specs. And, I am little bit concerned about the moving parts, especially the extend that the lens displaces but this you have to have for the huge zoom the camera offers.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great zoom, very light-weight, good in-between point and shoot and SLR, manual mode for aperature and shutter speed
Cons: High lighting action mode or completely still photographer and subject
I love my new P500! It is a great transitional camera to get to know the manual modes, but still has the automatic settings for when you are in a hurry and don't want to mess with it. Great zoom. Movable screen that is excellent to capture natural shots. The only issue is, of course, the low-lighting settings with any type of small movement with subject or photographer, but that is to be expected.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Mega Zoom, Shooting Features
Cons: Focusing and image quality
Bought this camera for personal use. I was choosing between the Canon Sx30is and this one. I chose this one for the following reasons.. Feels great in your hand, fun shooting features, high zoom, nice lcd screen. I returned it because the focusing is super slow and the picture quality is noticeably noisy. After I returned this I bought the Canon sx30is. The Canon focusing was way faster (thank you IS) but the picture quality was worse. I also returned the Canon. Now I'm holding my breath waiting for the Sony DSC HX100V .

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Got this camera a couple of weeks now and I love it. I love taking pictures and recently decided to take a step up and get a dslr camera. While checking out cameras, I realized that I might have to start out a little slower. This camera is great because it has the auto settings for almost every situation but also manual settings. So when I learn a little more about taking pics I can manipulate the settings. Its is light and easy to grip. The lens are built in and take absolutely great pics. I would recommend this camera to someone who wants to learn how to use dslr but is used to a point and shoot camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is a very nice product. I am amazed at all it's functions. It has a very nice zoom with clear pictures at full zoom. Low light pictures come out very nice as well even without a flash. I have also had good luck with high speed shots. It is very easy to use for basic point and shoot pictures. My 7 year old can already use it on her own. My only complaint so far is that the camera will turn on and try to hurt itself against the lens cover. I am afraid this is how I will eventually damage it. I have used other cameras that will either not turn on or will pop the cover off. This does not have those features. I would recommend this to a friend.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: The inexperienced can use this one.
Item.Review: Install the instruction CD & watch, from there everything is simple. Light weight & suitable for smaller female hands. Love the 36X zoom although it does take a little time to focus so be patient or that perfect shot will be slightly blurry. I did find the colour slightly lacking in brightness on photos taken in Central Australia where the blue, green & red are vivid.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: We bought the P500 to supplement our D7000 SLR, which we use primarily for shooting stills of our grandkids sports. The P500 does a great job of taking HD movies of the action without the bulk and weight of the larger camera. It is also used to take quality photos of my metal engraving. The highly reflective surface of the bare metal is always challenging, but the P500 handles it well. While it lacks many of the features of the D7000, they are not missed for our use.
Item.HelpfulCount: 1 out of 1 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good zoom and HD Video
Cons: Poor in low light and slow shutter speed
Nice camera, but low light picture taking is a bit of challenge. HD Video is nice, sound quality is average.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Cons: Lag / Shutter Delay; Poor Image Quality; Poor Image Stabilization; Short Battery Life
I owned an Olympus for at least 10 years, switched to Nikon because my friend who owns a portrait studio uses only Nikons and swears by them. I purchased this camera, and at the beginning, I thought the poor picture quality was because I wasn't fimiliar with the settings. After using this camera for about a year, I REALLY miss my Olympus. My iphone takes better pictures most of the time. We have gotten some good photos, but for the money I expected more!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Excellent purchase! This camera allows you to take good pictures in low light and with the built-in flash. The weak points are: to charge the battery, battery consumption and protection of the LCD monitor.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon Coolpix P500 Best Toy Ever
Item.Review: I've tested my new camera on a limited level - inside the home, only - because severe temperatures and conditions won't allow for its safe use outdoors but I'm very please with the options it otherwise allows me; the digital representation of the image is wonderfully clear...my top priority. At one point, I couldn't get the camera to power up even though the battery was at half power and the lense cap was off. The battery was not disturbed yet I took it out to check the contacts, replaced it, and it then worked; no clue why it didn't turn on. I hope this is the only fluke that surprises me.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: A little disappointed as my previous Coolpix P100 seemed to be a better camera. Also be aware this camera does not come with a manual, only a disc to download the manual to your computer. This does not make sense as I don't carry my computer around with me to read my camera manual. Nikon does not have a printed manual for this camera only the Quick Start Guide. I do like the panorama feature but not something I would use a lot. Don't like the fact that if you forget to remove the lens cover before turning the camera on you could damage the camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is AMAZING!!! the shots are great and the video is HD and great quality!! the pictures are very clear and amazing. There are so many settings so that you can get the perfect picture!!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: ABSOLUTELY NOTHING
Cons: TAKES HORRIBLE ACTION SHOTS
I had a P80 which was wonderful for taking action shots of my son playing in his high school football, basketball games and track meets. I broke it over Christmas and got this for my birthday. Pictures of my birthday in the house were blurred if there was any movement. Pictures in the gym at a basketball game were horrific blurs. I tried to take it back to BestBuy but they refused to take it back since it was a few days past the 14 day return for cameras. I live in a rural area and don't get into town that often and who knew that there was a limited time, most GOOD businesses have 30 day return policies on everything. So, I am stuck with a $400 piece of JUNK that is useless. The Geek squad guy told me that the blurs w ... ere normal. He showed me how to set it faster but you have to be outside from what he said. If that is normal for this camera, then why would anyone buy it? Why did the P80 take such great shots when it is an earlier model of this one. Don't waste your money. This is horrible. Best Buy is horrible. I will NEVER do business with them again that is for sure! Customer satifaction is something they are not concerned about! Do NOT buy this camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: More than a point & shoot camera
Item.Review: You can use settings or take pics maually. I love the tilt screen for just the right angle. Although I still use the viewfinder most of the time. The camera is compact and fits my hand perfectly. The 36 x zoom and wide angle features are great for scenery shots too. The only one drawback is learning all the features...it'll take me awhile.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera for my 16 year old daughter who is a beginner interested in photography. Great camera for the price. We are very pleased with picture quality. Would highly recommend to someone who wants to go above a point and shoot.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for the average picture taker
Item.Review:
Cons: Needs better photo settings (options)
I really like the camera although I feel like the picture settings could be improved. We have ended up with blurry pictures because of the setting options.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Size and weight
Cons: Autofocus, low light capability, motion shots
I bought this camera for my wife for Christmas. I wanted to get her a Canon PowerShot SX40, but they had sold out by the time I got there. I have had Nikon's in the past so I was okay buying this for her. She's a Kindergarten teacher and I was tired of her taking my Canon 7D to school. I wanted something that was easy to use for her. After playing with it for a few weeks now and seeing the pictures, I'm pretty disappointed. Low light pictures are terrible unless the flash is used everytime. Motion pictures again..... blurry. AF is not up to par for what I was expecting. It is very slow and confused like others have said on here. I will be returning this camera to buy the Canon now that I see it is back ... in stock at my local BestBuy. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: First I had the best help at B&H helping me to pick this camera. Someone who understood what I was looking for. It turns out he was right and I was not convinced at the time of the purchase, but as I have used the camera I realize what a good job this sales man did. I have used the camera basically as a point and shoot because I am traveling and have not had access to my computer yet. However my daughter got engaged over the holidays and I took a picture of her engagement ring for insurance purposes and we were all amazed at how sharp the picture is. The optics of this camera puts it head and shoulders above any basic point and shoot. I can't wait to download the user's manual and really get into what this amazing camera can do.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am now on my 3rd P500. The first 2 were defective. I have had problems with low light shooting, but mostly battery/charging system issues. The battery will be fully charged, yet not be able to power up the camera. Re-installing the battery usually solves this problem (for the one time); had the zoom extend itself all the way out and then the camera froze - had to re-install the battery to get the camera to power off. Outdoor shots are great. The panoramic feature is fun to use. Indoor shots are disappointing. I've read many other reviews similar to the complaints I've had. Either you get a good camera or a defective one - ratings are either 5 star or 1 - not much in-between. I've been a Nikon fan all my life; not so much now. If it wasn't for the fact that I've purchased extra ... batteries for this camera, I would've bought a different brand after the 1st defective one. However, if the 3rd camera starts having problems, I'll probably just go with a different brand. I can't recommend this camera without telling people about the problems I've had. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon's Coolpix P500 not so cool
Item.Review:
Cons: Poor focusing capability in indoor lighting
I had high expectations for Nikon's Coolpix P500. I had not purchased a camera for several years and with the P500's 36X optical zoom, I really wanted to try it.
But when I shot photos of my two daughters' choir performances at two different locations, I was very disappointed with the results.
On the automatic setting the P500 seemed to have trouble focusing on my subject. I took many photos and finally was able to capture a couple of in-focus pictures.
I was also disappointed in the overall quality of some of my other photos. It seemed the photo edges looked distorted, akin to looking at your image in a house of mirrors.
My old camera, a Panasonic Lumix, at least does a better job of focusing on the subje ... ct.
So last night I returned my P500 camera and plan on purchasing another Lumix, this time the FZ150, which Best Buy doesn't currently have in stock, so I'll have to take my business elsewhere. I hope for better results, otherwise maybe it's time to move up to a SLR. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Product used for multiple shooting experiences - outdoor, landscape, portraits, still life, architecture (interior and exterior),travel, etc. Zoom feature works well without tripod, except at ranges greater than 24X. Body seems flimsier than typical Nikon experience, but it is lightweight. View screen a good size, but has limits on viewability since it until tilts to a position about 30 to 35 degrees that can only be viewed from the top - unable to hold camera high above head and see view screen. So far, battery life OK, but would be nice to have charging cradle to charge extra battery, rather than having to charge within camera as standard option. Camera will not function unless lens cap removed first - different than older CoolPix models in that lens cap now attached to frame, rather tha ... n to lens, itself. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: It's quick, easy and produces nice pictures.
Cons: Digital cameras can not meet the demand of a 35mm
This Nikon camera is a great option for those who want more than a point and shoot camera. It has more options and produces nice pictures.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I would return if I could & buy @ Canon
Item.Review:
Pros: Nikon durability
Cons: Firmware upgrade; Blurry in low light; Poor mini effect; Poor Image Stabilization
I have a Nikon D7000 and wanted something smaller on some occassions. My bad after trying a Canon I liked the movie mini-effects & assumed the Nikon's was that good or better. It's not. W/O a tripod the Zoom is blurry if not used in bright light. W/a tripod it's ok. There is a battery problem but if you turn off "charge by computer" and download the firmware that will resolve.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for someone new digital age
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use & Great price
Camera takes great pictures with great results. I have tried take all pictures in different scence modes and auto scence selection which to me work great. Hope to get more involved with the camera as I learn about the camera and how to take even better shots.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Ok, thought it would be better
Item.Review:
Pros: Zoom, frames per second (burst),
Cons: video stabilization, takes great shots only with great lighting conditions
The zoom is great. The shots per second is great. There are other nice features but I primarily bought the camera to take sport action shots. Under right lighting conditions shots turn out pretty good. Games under the lights at night you might as well forget about though. Outside in the daylight is about it. The stabilization on video isn't very good.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great for everything but sport photos
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality; Large Clear LCD; Great Zoom; Easy To Use
Cons: Poor Image Stabilization; Short Battery Life; Lag / Shutter Delay; Poor action photos blurry
Macro photos are superb, in low light the auto focus just keeps trying but never quite locks on, all sports photos blurry and no Friday Night Lights Football Game photos...could not handle low light, shiny helmets and action. The continuous function never focuses so you get many blurry photos. Portraits, landscapes, pets all beautiful with excellent details. Flash average for close up subjects. Battery does not last as described - keep lots of extras. If I could return it I would. Not as advertised.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice pictures
Cons: short battery life
I like this camera, it takes quick pictures on auto and has plenty of little perks that make it a good camera. I like the inside pictures.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Large Clear LCD; Good in Low Light; Nice Body Color
Cons: Keeps attempting to focus; Poor for distant movement; Can only charge the batte; No manual focus
I mainly bought it for the long zoom lens. I travel in an RV and want to take pics of wild animals at a distance. It's not good for that at all as it keeps attempting to focus and I've missed many shots. When the zoom lens is out the camera becomes unsteady do to the uneven weight in the front but you can't touch the lens or manually focus it. I bought the wrong camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I love the light weight, compact size, ease of use and versatility. The only negative is the battery life. I haven't used all of the features yet because there are so many different modes and ways to use the camera. The camera is very easy to use in the automatic mode though. Just turn it on an shoot. But do yourself a favor and buy an extra battery and keep it charged, because the life of the battery is ridiculously short.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: EVERYTHING!
This camera is so awesome! I love it! I previously owned a Canon point n shoot camera and it was slow. This Nikon camera is very fast shooting and the picture quality is great! The mega zoom feature is great too!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great pictures even if you don't read the manual.
Item.Review:
Pros: EASY
Cons: needs more high speed recording time per session.
I've bought my wife many point and shoot cameras and she refuses to pay attention to the features that help take quality pictures. Turn the dial to auto on this camera and over 90% of the pictures come out great. I've read the manual and the camera can take a quality picture anywhere.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Great pictures, features and video
Cons: I still need to learn how to use it. Sometimes I take some blurry pictures, but I think its user error.
It was between this and a Canon. I went with the P500 because of the 1080p full HD resolution and i found that the ease of use was better than the other Canons I tried out at Best Buy.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted a small, lightweight camera that I could carry with me all the time. I have two D90's for planned shooting but don't want to carry one of them unless I know I'll need it. The P500 does the job for me with HD video, vibration reduction, high resolution stills all in a light weight package!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The camera has many options and settings to play around but it disapointed me a bit in image quality, specially when talking about colours, at least in the automatic mode. It also deforms the image a little. In the other hand, i loved the super zoom, the many shooting options and manual controls (I came from a compact camera). I'm still playing and learning how to use ir better but in the overal, it's a good camera. Just dont expect too much.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: A lot of camera in a small package.
Cons: You need the camera to download to P.C.
I bought this camera to replace an Olympus E500. I was getting tired of carrying that "Brick" around. This little camera is light weight and every bit a camera the old Olympus was. The power in that little box is very good. Images are sharp and clean. Flexibility is amazing. The 36X zoom is very good. I think this is a sweet little secret.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: i had a 10 year old Nikon that i loved and was stolen, so i wanted another that had similar features, because i knew how to use my old camera. both were high functioning point and shoot, style. i am so impressed with the quality, ease, and reliability of this product. the only drawback for me is that i have to charge my extra battery in my camera, i can't put it in a charger. this is awkward for me.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nikon COOLPIX P500 - Good Quality Camera
Item.Review: Camera is used primarily when the wife and I vacation at various places around the world. Have used Olympus super-zoom camera's in the past, didn't like their offerings and decided to go with Nikon this time. Zoom is great, picture quality is good, but may want to take off some of the noise reduction for certain photo's depending on the situation as some photo's can be fuzzy due to it. Video quality looks great - default setting is for fixed focus, be sure to set it to auto-focus if using in an active situation. One downside - for the price, and with the supported SD card sizes, should be able to save RAW image formats - it's restricted to JPEG's only - that's the only downside I see so far.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am a traveler and spend much my life in Vienna, Austria and Port Townsend, Washington. This new camera has been a wonderful companion. I rejected the SLR models because they are simply too large. You have to carry extra lenses in addition! So, I bought this nice little whiz-banger. It's still bigger than I want. I liked the size of the old 35 mm SLR - especially my old Pentax's. But time and technology have changed and now I'm a digital whiz-banger. Another reason to reject the SLR was because my wife could not grasp the concept of extra lenses when you can get it all in this P500 with its super close-up abilities and fantastic 36X power zoom. Of course you must place it on a stable surface or on a tripod to use the powerful extension extreme telephoto.The only negative for me is the fol ... dout up/down/angled monitor. I have not found a need for it. The mechanism could break (although it is sturdy) and it adds a bit of bulk and weight. I would rather have it without the monitor extension. That's the only reason for the 4 stars instead of 5[...] expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am a professional photographer and routinely use several high end Nikon DSLRs, but I find the versatility of the Nikon P500 takes it with me everywhere and is my go to camera at home, on vacation, and actually most of my garden variety shooting. I also own the (two versions back) Nikon P80 which uses a 18X focal length lens, and it was impressive. This 36X P500 takes me from very wide angle to the equivalent of 800mm, and the image stabilization allows me to hand hold the extreme telephoto with tack sharp results. And, the same vibration reduction feature allows very low light images with no loss in clarity. Being old school I shoot nearly everything through the electronics viewfinder, but when it comes to grass-level subjects, I quickly learned the value of the tilt out back display to ... get really close to tiny subjects, knee-high to a grasshopper. I use this camera extensively in the garden taking extreme closeups and then in Photoshop I zoom into different regions of the 12.1 MP image to extract details and different compositions not seen before. Again the versatility is truly amazing and I'm still finding new applications every day. Does it replace my DSLRs? Not at all, but I use the P500 more often now than my other cameras. Simple as that. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good Deal on a Great Camera
Item.Review: Good point-n-shoot camera for the non-pro user. Much better dynamic range (shows details in bright and dim shots) than a cheaper camera I had been using. The only thing I do not like is it is very difficult to get good focus on objects less than a foot away or even backing off and zooming in. The cheaper camera did a far better job.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought this camera 'cause my wife and I will soon be vacationing in the mountains of the Big Bend in West Texas. But I've started using it already and, wow! It is simple to use and takes great and sharp pictures. Snapshots of family and friends are a snap and we have also taken nature photos. I'm still exploring features and have stuck mostly with the Auto setting, which works great. The one drawback so far has been image shakiness at full 36X zoom; hard to keep the camera steady at that setting. If you're taking a really long telephoto shot, you need a tripod for steadiness, but I think that's true of most cameras. This is a Nikon-refurbished camera and it looks and works like it's brand new.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Lots and Lots of Camera for the price
Item.Review: A great Bridge camera for those who want more than a point and shoot, but don't want the hassle of lens changing with a DSLR. The 36X optical zoom gives a tremendously large range of shooting options, and crystal clear pictures. The angle ranges on the 3 LCD give you the ability to get the shot from any angle.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great camera for the price. It is a refurbished item so I did take an extended warranty to be safe. Really like it. Could be a little confusing to set the date, etc, but got through it eventually.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Easy to use and great price.
I love my new camera. It takes great pictures! I love to take pictures and I wanted something that would take good quality pictures. This is definitely the right camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great travel camera and small enough for personal use. Good zoom coverage and tilt screen to view daylight shooting. In addition to viewfinder which I use a lot.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Great camera for the intermediate user.
Item.Review:
Pros: Has a fantastic ability to capture great pictures even at max zoom in a wide variety of conditions.
Cons: Can be used by a novice but have to have some knowlege to get the best out of it.
Great camera so far. Comes packed with features. Fairly easy to use for a novice but to bring out the best pictures you have to have a little more knowledge of photography. Even at max zoom in low light conditions takes fantastic pictures.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: My wife and I wanted something to take faster and better pictures on trips, as well as for our kid. We didn't want to drop the full amount for a DSLR camera, but this camera more than fits everything.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: The CoolpixP500 is easy to use and the (non-zoom)photos look great. However, using the zoom at or near the max is pretty difficult without a tripod or some other support. The least little shake - even breathing! - leaves you with a blurry image. Other than that, I'm happy with it. I especially love the viewfinder with the adjustment dial that allows me to see what I'm shooting without putting on reading glasses.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: able to take 25 pictures at a shot but the quality of those pics is bad
Cons: getting stressed out because you can't get a good picture out if this camera
I hate this camera... My Christmas pictures were a complete disaster. I could not get satisfactory quality pictures even after trying all the settings in different scenarios for a few weeks …. Hard to focus, blurred and distorted pictures, continuous shooting was fast and nice to get 25 pictures at a shot but the quality of those pictures was devastating (what’s the point of having a nice continuous shooting when the quality is worse than bad? My very old digital Sony takes much better pictures). I ended up returning this camera and getting a Canon PowerShot SX40.HS. That was the smartest thing I did. If you’re loo ... king for a good point and shoot with great picture quality and easy to use try Canon. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Sharp photo image, ease of use. Rechargeable battery included ( may have to charge it before first use.)
Cons: Instruction manual on CD.
At least it was for me. This is the second digital camera purchased (the first was stolen). I like that it can be used almost right out of the box with the general instructions. Another plus is the rechargeable battery is included. You don't have to worry about purchasing batteries anymore.The complete instruction manual, however, is on a CD instead of book form. Minor inconvenience for me, not a big problem.
All in all, a very easy camera to use. The pictures are great and once you familiarize you self with some of the other features (such as taking back lit photos or night photos), your picture taking experience and enjoyment ... will increase. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: A Camera us OLDIES can figure out
Item.Review: I have traveled all over the world and have used my Coolpix P2 on my trips and have even had one of my photos published in a major newspaper. It was time to upgrade my camera. I don't belive in todays world that it is the camera, It is the sight of the user. However, my new camera is an upgrade and makes picture taking easier in the sun when you can see the screen since you have a viewer. The minus side is that it is heavier.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: View finder option, good in low light
Cons: flash is not automatic but it works well in low light even when you forget the flash
Love the view finder feature. It was hard to find this feature on a camera within my price range. Great camera for the price.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: I am a beginner and have gotten...
Item.Review:
Pros: Photo sharpness
Cons: Can't turn the camera on with the lens cap on
A LOT out of this camera... Although it took me a couple of days to figure out the features I read the manual and now know what/how to use different settings in... I haven't had the battery problems like everyone else nor have I had a problem with the image stabilization
It takes beautiful pictures that even my dad is impressed with and he served 22 years in the Navy as a photographer

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Love it... would definitely recommend it
Item.Review: If you are looking for a top-of the line point and shoot this is the way to go! The Nikon P500 has all the flairs you need to take a great pictures, without the expense of a SLR...

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I wanted to have a Nikon camera but i didn't want to deal with changing lenses, so this camera is perfect!!! The only thing so far I have to complain is that I have to have my hands very steady to get clear pictures.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera is great as a point and shoot, right out of the box, and has the options that make it more interesting anf functional for the more advanced photographer. It is a great camera to grow with for this very reason. The settings are easy to learn and understand, so that even the most novice photgrapher can get to shooting great pics right away. A nice feature is that there are 2 zoom controls, One on the top of the camera near the shoot button, and the other is near the lens - which gives a more manual feel. The camera is reasonably light, and has a comfortable fit in the hand.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I am new to photography and this is my first camera. I love it so far and it takes really good photos. The zoom is absolutely amazing. My friend has an incredible telephoto lens and yet she still can't take the kind of photos I can from a distance.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great camera! I bought the camera for my soon-to-be wife for Christmas. We are going to Disney World for our honeymoon in May. This camera had the best zoom capabilities available for a point and shoot. The 1080p HD video looks great on my iMac so far. I can't wait to take this camera to WDW and enjoy the memories we bring home.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: a lot of pictures are out of focus, mainly because it takes it so long to focus and I tend to take the picture before the moment is gone... if you have kids you'll know what I mean...

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Lightweight, Compact, and Easy To Use
Item.Review: I am more a traveler than a photographer. Wildlife and scenery are my usual subjects. I've found it easy to get used too. What really impresses me is the weight, super light. My g-friend with her huge 300mm lense has camera envy.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is one of the best cameras I have purchased and will enjoy it for years as it will take me that long to learn all its capabilities. But that is half the fun. Some of manual is not written that well that it is immediatley understandable, but I'll get the hang of it by trial and error. Of course if you put this camera on Auto, it simplifies things immensely and takes great photos.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is the perfect all-around camera for someone who only wants to take one and not mess with changing lens'. It takes great photos and is very easy to operate.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix P500 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Large Clear LCD; Fast/accurate auto-focus; Good in Low Light; Small / Compact; Good Image Quality; Easy To Use; Good Image Stabilization
Cons: Short Battery Life
